ground_truth: Bob pulls his son close and hugs him with all his might, tears filling his eyes. Charlie tried hard to push, and there it is a baby's cries. Audrey stood stunned, standing wide-eyed and holding up the child. Audrey reacts, crosses to the counter, turns on the radio, trying to drown out the sound of the approaching menace. Out of the static, the haunting sounds of Bing Crosby singing "Silent Night" fill the room. The quiet before the storm. Michael helps Charlie quickly clean herself up. She stares at him, a burning spite in her eyes. Those words provide her little comfort. Charlie shakes her head, this is all too much. Michael nods grimly. Charlie looks urgently at Michael. The baby cries louder. Charlie, shaken by this revelation, reaches out to Audrey. Audrey moves to hand over the baby to Charlie. Sandra backs away from them, moving toward the front door. Michael cocks his gun, points it at Sandra. Charlie squares off with Sandra, panic in her eyes. Charlie stares at her in horror, the truth of those words rattling her to the very core. A brilliant spectral light pours into the diner. She raises a hand to block the light. And that's when Michael fires. BLAM! Sandra staggers back, blood dripping from the hole in her forehead. Michael fires again, blowing Sandra's body back through the doorway. Jeep watches the baby sail slowly through the air. Jeep dives for the baby, catching the bundle of rags mere inches from the ground, and then he looks up to see the dark silhouette of a man approaching from out of the spectral light, a man with wings. Jeep's eyes grow wide as the fierce angel steps into the diner. The angel's wings retract with clockwork-like precision, and now that we see his face clearly, we notice his striking resemblance to Michael. Gabriel raises a massive, ferocious, strangely mechanical-looking mace in his powerful hands. The world returns to normal speed as Gabriel brings the mace arcing down at Jeep. Jeep rolls, clang! The weapon just misses him, hitting the floor in a spray of sparks, literally cracking the ground. Gabriel brings the mace up again. With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. Michael grabs Jeep's hand before the boy can rush back into the fray. Michael lets go of Jeep's hand and turns away to face Gabriel, leaving Jeep to contemplate those final words. And that's when Jeep opens his hand to find the keys to Michael's police cruiser. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Bob draws his offspring near and embraces him with all his strength, tears filling his eyes. Charlie endeavored hard to thrust, and there it is a baby's wails. Audrey remained astonished, standing wide-eyed and holding up the infant. Audrey acts, moves to the counter, turns on the radio, attempting to drown out the sound of the advancing danger. Out of the static, the eerie tones of Bing Crosby crooning "Silent Night" fill the room. The calm before the tempest. Michael assists Charlie quickly tidy herself up. She gazes at him, a burning resentment in her eyes. Those words provide her slight solace. Charlie shakes her head, this is all too overwhelming. Michael nods somberly. Charlie looks urgently at Michael. The infant cries louder. Charlie, unsettled by this disclosure, reaches out to Audrey. Audrey moves to pass the infant to Charlie. Sandra retreats from them, moving toward the front portal. Michael cocks his firearm, aims it at Sandra. Charlie confronts Sandra, panic in her eyes. Charlie gazes at her in terror, the truth of those words shaking her to the very core. A brilliant ethereal light streams into the diner. She raises a hand to shield the light. And that's when Michael fires. BLAM! Sandra reels back, blood oozing from the hole in her forehead. Michael fires again, propelling Sandra's body back through the entrance. Jeep observes the infant drift gradually through the air. Jeep lunges for the infant, catching the bundle of rags mere inches from the ground, and then he raises his eyes to see the dark outline of a man approaching from out of the ethereal light, a man with wings. Jeep's eyes widen as the fierce angel steps into the diner. The angel's wings retract with clockwork-like precision, and now that we see his face clearly, we observe his striking likeness to Michael. Gabriel raises a massive, fearsome, strangely mechanical-looking club in his formidable hands. The world resumes normal pace as Gabriel brings the club arcing down at Jeep. Jeep rolls, clang! The weapon just misses him, striking the floor in a spray of sparks, literally shattering the ground. Gabriel lifts the club again. With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. Michael seizes Jeep's hand before the youth can dash back into the fray. Michael releases Jeep's hand and turns away to confront Gabriel, leaving Jeep to ponder those final words. And that's when Jeep opens his hand to find the keys to Michael's police vehicle. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie, Audrey, and the infant.

Jeep's eyes are grown wide as the fierce angel steps into the diner. With clockwork-like precision, the angel's wings retract, and now that we see his face clearly, we notice his striking resemblance to Michael. In his powerful hands, Gabriel raises a massive, ferocious, strangely mechanical-looking mace. As Gabriel brings the mace arcing down at Jeep, the world returns to normal speed. Jeep rolls, clang! The floor is just missed by the weapon, hitting it in a spray of sparks, literally cracking the ground. Gabriel brings the mace up again. With a sweep of his hand, Bob is sent flying across the diner by Gabriel where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. And that's when the keys to Michael's police cruiser are found by Jeep in his hand. From the keys, Jeep looks up to see Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Bob hugs his son tightly, tears brimming. Charlie pushes hard, and a baby's cry fills the room. Audrey, wide-eyed, holds the child and turns on the radio to mask the approaching threat. Through static, Bing Crosby's "Silent Night" plays, a calm before chaos. Michael helps Charlie clean up, while Charlie, overwhelmed, looks at him with mixed emotions. The baby cries louder. Charlie, shaken, reaches for Audrey, who hands her the baby. Sandra moves towards the door, and Michael aims his gun at her. Charlie faces Sandra, panic-stricken. A spectral light floods the diner. Michael fires, hitting Sandra. He shoots again, sending her body through the doorway. Jeep dives to catch the baby, then sees a winged figure approaching. The angel's wings retract as he enters the diner, resembling Michael. Gabriel, wielding a mechanical mace, swings at Jeep, narrowly missing. Gabriel strikes again, sending Bob flying across the diner. Michael stops Jeep, handing him keys to his police cruiser. Jeep looks up to see Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Bob hugs his son tightly, tears in his eyes. Charlie pushes hard, and a baby cries. Audrey, stunned, holds the child, turns on the radio to drown out approaching danger. Bing Crosby's "Silent Night" plays. Michael helps Charlie clean up as she gazes at him spitefully. Charlie, overwhelmed, shakes her head and reaches for Audrey, who hands over the baby. Sandra backs away toward the door. Michael points his gun at Sandra. Charlie faces Sandra, panicked. A spectral light enters the diner as Michael fires. BLAM! Sandra falls, bloodied. Michael fires again, sending Sandra's body back. Jeep dives, catching the baby. He sees a winged man approaching—Gabriel, resembling Michael. Gabriel raises a mechanical mace at Jeep. Jeep rolls, and the mace cracks the ground. Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner. Michael grabs Jeep’s hand, then lets go, facing Gabriel. Jeep finds the keys to Michael’s cruiser and sees Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Bob pulls his son close, embracing him with all the strength he can muster, tears welling up and spilling over from the corners of his eyes. Meanwhile, Charlie is giving it her all, straining hard to push, and then, at last, the unmistakable sound of a baby's cries fills the air. Audrey stands there, utterly stunned, her eyes wide with astonishment as she holds the newborn child aloft. Reacting quickly, Audrey moves briskly across the room to the counter, turning on the radio in a desperate attempt to drown out the ominous noise of the menace that seems to be drawing nearer. Out of the static comes the hauntingly beautiful voice of Bing Crosby crooning "Silent Night," filling the room with a poignant melody—the eerie calm before the impending storm. 

In the midst of this, Michael steps in to assist Charlie, helping her clean herself up as swiftly as possible. Charlie fixes a penetrating stare on him, her eyes burning with a deep-seated spite. To her, those words he offers grant her little in the way of solace. Shaking her head, Charlie feels utterly overwhelmed by the enormity of it all. Michael nods in response, his expression grim and serious. She looks at him with urgency, turning her attention back to the increasingly loud cries of the baby. Shaken by the gravity of this revelation, Charlie reaches out beseechingly to Audrey. In response, Audrey moves to carefully hand the baby over to Charlie. Meanwhile, Sandra begins to back away, edging toward the front door in a retreat. 

With a measured and deliberate action, Michael cocks his gun, directing it toward Sandra. In that tense moment, Charlie stands her ground, facing off against Sandra with panic clearly etched in her eyes. Horror-stricken, she stares at Sandra as the truth of those words hits her, shaking her to her very core. Suddenly, a dazzlingly brilliant spectral light floods into the diner, forcing her to raise a hand in an attempt to shield her eyes from its intensity. And it is at that precise moment when Michael pulls the trigger. BLAM! The sound echoes, and Sandra staggers backward, blood trickling from the newly formed hole in her forehead. Michael fires once more, sending Sandra's body flying backward through the doorway. 

Jeep watches as if in slow motion, the baby sailing gently through the air. He dives forward, catching the fragile bundle of rags just inches from the hard ground. As he looks up, his eyes widen in shock upon seeing the dark silhouette of a figure emerging from the spectral light—a man with wings. Jeep's eyes grow even more round with awe and fear as the fierce angel steps into the diner. The angel's magnificent wings retract with a clockwork-like precision, and now that his face is clearly visible, there is a striking resemblance to Michael. Gabriel lifts a massive, fearsome, and strangely mechanical-looking mace high in his powerful hands. 

Time returns to its normal speed as Gabriel swings the mace down at Jeep. Jeep rolls out of the way just in time, and clang! The weapon narrowly misses him, hitting the floor with a spray of sparks, literally cracking the ground beneath it. Gabriel raises the mace once more, bringing it up for another strike. With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner, where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove with a thud. Meanwhile, Michael intercepts Jeep's hand before the boy can dash back into the chaos, momentarily halting him. 

Michael releases his hold on Jeep's hand, turning away to confront Gabriel, leaving Jeep alone to ponder those final, weighty words. And it's at that precise moment when Jeep opens his hand to discover the keys to Michael's police cruiser resting there. With realization dawning, Jeep looks up from the keys to take in the sight of Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Bob pulls his son close to him, wrapping his arms around the boy with all the strength he can summon, tears welling up in his eyes before spilling over the edges. Meanwhile, Charlie is exerting every ounce of effort she has, straining with all her might to push. Finally, the unmistakable sound of a newborn baby's cries fills the room, echoing around them. Audrey stands there, utterly taken aback, an expression of pure astonishment on her face as she holds the newborn child aloft. Reacting quickly, she moves swiftly across the room to the counter, hurriedly turning on the radio in a desperate bid to drown out the ominous noise of the approaching menace that seems to be drawing closer with every passing moment. Through the static, the hauntingly beautiful voice of Bing Crosby rises, crooning "Silent Night," a poignant melody that fills the room with an eerie calm, the unsettling peace before the impending storm.

Amidst all this, Michael steps forward to lend a hand to Charlie, diligently helping her clean herself up as quickly as possible. Charlie fixes a penetrating and unwavering stare on him, her eyes ablaze with a deep-seated and simmering spite. To her, the words he offers provide little in the way of comfort. Shaking her head in disbelief, Charlie feels utterly overwhelmed by the sheer enormity of everything happening around her. In response, Michael nods, his expression set in a grim and serious manner. Sensing the urgency of the situation, she turns her attention back to the baby's cries, growing louder and more insistent. Shaken by the gravity of this revelation, Charlie reaches out with desperation to Audrey, who, in turn, moves to carefully place the newborn child in Charlie's outstretched arms. Meanwhile, Sandra begins to back away, inching toward the front door in a hesitant retreat.

With a steady and deliberate motion, Michael raises his gun, aiming it toward Sandra. In that tense moment, Charlie stands her ground, confronting Sandra with panic etched clearly across her features. Horrified, she fixes her gaze on Sandra as the truth of the situation crashes over her, shaking her to the very core. Suddenly, a dazzlingly brilliant and spectral light floods into the diner, forcing her to raise a hand to shield her eyes from its blinding intensity. It is at that precise moment that Michael pulls the trigger. BLAM! The sound reverberates through the air, and Sandra staggers backward, blood trickling from the freshly formed wound in her forehead. Michael fires once more, his second shot sending Sandra's body hurtling backward through the doorway.

Jeep watches the scene unfold as if in slow motion, observing the baby sailing gently through the air. He dives forward, managing to catch the fragile bundle of rags just inches from the hard ground. As he looks up, his eyes widen in shock as he catches sight of a dark silhouette emerging from the spectral light—a man with wings. Jeep's eyes grow round with a mixture of awe and fear as the fierce angel steps into the diner. The angel's magnificent wings retract with a clockwork-like precision, and as his face becomes clearly visible, it bears a striking resemblance to Michael. Gabriel lifts a massive, fearsome, and strangely mechanical-looking mace high above his head in his powerful hands.

Time seems to return to its normal speed as Gabriel swings the mace down toward Jeep. Jeep rolls out of the way just in time, and clang! The impressive weapon narrowly misses him, striking the floor with a spray of sparks and literally cracking the ground beneath its force. Gabriel raises the mace once again, lifting it high for another deadly strike. With a sweeping gesture of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner, where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove with a resounding thud. Meanwhile, Michael intercepts Jeep's hand before the boy can dash back into the chaos, momentarily halting him in his tracks.

Michael releases his grip on Jeep’s hand, making the decision to turn away and confront Gabriel, thereby leaving Jeep alone with thoughts of those final, weighty words. At that precise moment, Jeep opens his hand to discover the keys to Michael's police cruiser resting in his palm. With realization dawning on him, Jeep lifts his gaze from the keys and looks up to take in the sight of Charlie, Audrey, and the baby, contemplating what must be done next.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Bob, overcome with emotion, pulls his son close to his chest and embraces him tightly, feeling the tears well up in his eyes as he holds him with all his might. Meanwhile, Charlie struggles with intense effort, and suddenly, the sound of a baby's cries fills the air. Audrey, standing nearby, is caught off guard by the situation, her eyes wide as she holds up the newborn child. In an attempt to block out the rising tension, Audrey hurriedly crosses to the counter and switches on the radio. As she fiddles with the radio, the chilling yet familiar voice of Bing Crosby singing "Silent Night" emerges from the static, filling the room with an eerie calm, like a quiet before an impending storm. Amidst the charged atmosphere, Michael assists Charlie in quickly tidying herself up. Charlie fixates on Michael with a fierce determination and a hint of resentment as the realization of their predicament offers her little solace. Despite these feelings, the weight of the situation is overwhelming, and she shakes her head in disbelief. Michael acknowledges her reaction with a grim nod, understanding the gravity of their situation. Desperation creeps into Charlie's demeanor as she looks urgently at Michael, the baby's cries growing more insistent and piercing. Shaken by the intensity of the moment, Charlie extends a hand toward Audrey, who carefully moves forward to hand the baby over to her. Meanwhile, Sandra, sensing the rising tension, starts to retreat, inching her way toward the front door. Observing this, Michael decisively cocks his gun and directs it at Sandra, the room's atmosphere thick with tension. Charlie, consumed by panic, positions herself directly in front of Sandra, her eyes wide with horror as the truth of their reality sinks in deeply, rattling her to her core. As if on cue, a brilliant spectral light floods the diner, momentarily blinding everyone present. Instinctively, Charlie raises a hand to shield her eyes from the intense light. In that charged instant, Michael makes a split-second decision and fires his weapon with a resounding BLAM! The shot finds its mark, and Sandra staggers backward, blood streaming from the wound in her forehead. Without hesitation, Michael fires again, and Sandra's body is propelled backward through the doorway. Jeep, witnessing the chaotic scene, follows the baby's trajectory as it sails slowly through the air. With a determined leap, Jeep lunges for the baby, catching the fragile bundle of rags just inches before it can hit the ground. Relieved yet cautious, Jeep looks up, his gaze meeting the dark silhouette of a man emerging ominously from the spectral light—a man with wings. Jeep's eyes widen in shock and disbelief as the imposing angel steps into the diner, his wings retracting with clockwork-like precision, revealing a face strikingly similar to that of Michael. Gabriel, the angel, lifts a massive and fearsome mace, its design strangely mechanical and formidable, as if destined for destruction. The pace of the world seems to slow as Gabriel swings the mace down toward Jeep with deadly intent. In a reflexive move, Jeep rolls sideways, narrowly avoiding the mace as it crashes into the floor with a violent clang, sending sparks flying and cracking the ground beneath it. Observing the chaos, Gabriel raises the mace once more, his presence menacing and unyielding. With a swift and powerful motion, Gabriel sends Bob hurtling across the diner, where he lands with a heavy thud behind the counter near the stove. Desperate to intervene, Michael seizes Jeep's hand, preventing him from plunging back into the fray. With a silent acknowledgment, Michael releases Jeep's hand and turns resolutely to face Gabriel, leaving Jeep to ponder the weight of his final words. It's at this moment that Jeep discovers something unexpected in the palm of his hand—the keys to Michael's police cruiser. Surprised and uncertain, Jeep lifts his eyes from the keys to the scene before him, taking in the sight of Charlie, Audrey, and the infant in their shared moment of vulnerability and determination.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Bob embraces his son tightly, tears welling in his eyes, as Audrey, initially stunned by the baby's cries, moves to the counter and turns on the radio to mask the ominous approach with Bing Crosby's "Silent Night." Michael assists Charlie in cleaning up, but her burning gaze reflects her turmoil and the ineffectiveness of his words. As Charlie, overwhelmed, seeks assurance and reaches for the baby, Audrey hands the child over. Meanwhile, Sandra retreats toward the front door, prompting Michael to ready his gun. A tense confrontation ensues between Charlie and Sandra. A spectral light floods the diner, briefly blinding Charlie. Michael seizes the moment to fire at Sandra, who staggers and falls, her body propelled through the doorway by a second shot. Amidst the chaos, Jeep lunges to catch the baby as it falls. Upon securing the child, Jeep notices a winged figure approaching through the light—an angel resembling Michael. As Gabriel's wings retract, he wields a fearsome, mechanical mace, striking toward Jeep, who narrowly avoids the blow. In a swift motion, Gabriel hurls Bob across the diner. Michael restrains Jeep from re-entering the fray, entrusting him with the keys to his police cruiser. Jeep, absorbing the gravity of the moment, glances from the keys to Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Bob pulls his son close and hugs him with all his might, tears filling his eyes, a poignant moment heightened by the tension in the air. Charlie tried hard to push, and there it is—a baby's cries, the sound which signifies a new life amidst the chaos. Audrey stood stunned, standing wide-eyed and holding up the child, reminiscent of historic moments when newborns symbolize hope and change. Audrey reacts, crosses to the counter, turns on the radio, trying to drown out the sound of the approaching menace, the ominous presence that has been forewarned by those who predicted its arrival. Out of the static, the haunting sounds of Bing Crosby singing "Silent Night" fill the room, a classic song from the 1942 film "Holiday Inn" known for its calming yet poignant notes. The quiet before the storm, a telling phrase often used to describe the eerie calmness before chaos ensues. Michael helps Charlie quickly clean herself up, a moment akin to battle preparations after the arrival of significant news. She stares at him, a burning spite in her eyes, fueled by the betrayal she feels. Those words provide her little comfort in a world that seems to be unraveling. Charlie shakes her head, this is all too much, as if grappling with unfathomable truths that have recently come to light. Michael nods grimly, understanding the weight of their shared predicament. Charlie looks urgently at Michael, seeking answers in the midst of an unfolding crisis. The baby cries louder, its cries echoing the urgency felt by the adults. Charlie, shaken by this revelation, reaches out to Audrey, a gesture of trust and desperation. Audrey moves to hand over the baby to Charlie, the child representing the future they all must protect. Sandra backs away from them, moving toward the front door, her actions driven by fear and self-preservation. Michael cocks his gun, points it at Sandra, a decisive action that underscores the escalating tension. Charlie squares off with Sandra, panic in her eyes, as the reality of their divided loyalties comes to light. Charlie stares at her in horror, the truth of those words rattling her to the very core, as they echo deep-seated fears. A brilliant spectral light pours into the diner, a blinding illumination that signifies the arrival of something otherworldly. She raises a hand to block the light, instinctively shielding herself from the unknown. And that's when Michael fires. BLAM! Sandra staggers back, blood dripping from the hole in her forehead, a grim testament to the violence that has erupted. Michael fires again, blowing Sandra's body back through the doorway, a shocking culmination of the confrontation. Jeep watches the baby sail slowly through the air, the motion seemingly suspended in time. Jeep dives for the baby, catching the bundle of rags mere inches from the ground, a heroic act that underscores his agility and determination, and then he looks up to see the dark silhouette of a man approaching from out of the spectral light, a man with wings, reminiscent of angelic figures from religious texts. Jeep's eyes grow wide as the fierce angel steps into the diner, his presence commanding and fearsome. The angel's wings retract with clockwork-like precision, an almost mechanical display of divine prowess, and now that we see his face clearly, we notice his striking resemblance to Michael, suggesting a deeper connection or conflict between them. Gabriel raises a massive, ferocious, strangely mechanical-looking mace in his powerful hands, a weapon that seems to combine ancient and futuristic elements. The world returns to normal speed as Gabriel brings the mace arcing down at Jeep, a testament to the tension building in the room. Jeep rolls, clang! The weapon just misses him, hitting the floor in a spray of sparks, literally cracking the ground, demonstrating its immense power. Gabriel brings the mace up again, preparing for another attack. With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove, a testament to the angel's overwhelming strength. Michael grabs Jeep's hand before the boy can rush back into the fray, a protective act amidst the chaos. Michael lets go of Jeep's hand and turns away to face Gabriel, leaving Jeep to contemplate those final words, the weight of which hangs heavily in the air. And that's when Jeep opens his hand to find the keys to Michael's police cruiser, a symbol of trust and responsibility handed to him. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie, Audrey, and the baby, the small group forming a fragile alliance in the face of otherworldly threats.

test_cases.description: Bob pulls his son close and hugs him with all his might tears filling his eyes. Charlie tried hard to push and there it is. a baby's cries. Audrey stood stunned standing wideeyed and holding up the child. Audrey reacts crosses to the counter turns on the radio trying to drown out the sound of the approaching menace. Out of the static the haunting sounds of Bing Crosby singing Silent Night fill the room. The quiet before the storm. Michael helps Charlie quickly clean herself up. She stares at him a burning spite in her eyes. Those words provide her little comfort. Charlie shakes her head. this is all too much. Michael nods grimly. Charlie looks urgently at Michael. The baby cries louder. Charlie shaken by this revelation reaches out to Audrey. Audrey moves to hand over the baby to Charlie. Sandra backs away from them moving toward the front door. Michael cocks his gun points it at Sandra. Charlie squares off with Sandra panic in her eyes. Charlie stares at her in horror. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. the truth of those words rattling her to the very core. A brilliant spectral light pours into the diner. She raises a hand to block the light. And that is when Michael fires BLAM. Sandra staggers back blood dripping from the hole in her forehead. Michael fires again blowing Sandra's body back through the doorway. Jeep watches the baby sail slowly through the air. Jeep dives for the baby catching the bundle of rags mere inches from the ground and then he looks up to see the dark silhouette of a man approaching from out of the spectral light. a man with wings. Jeep's eyes grow wide as the fierce angel steps into the diner. The angel's wings retract with clockworklike precision and now that we see his face clearly we notice his striking resemblance to Michael. Gabriel raises a massive ferocious strangely mechanicallooking mace in his powerful hands. The world returns to normal speed as Gabriel brings the mace arcing down at Jeep. Jeep rolls clang. The weapon just misses him hitting the floor in a spray of sparks literally cracking the ground. Gabriel brings the mace up again. With a sweep of his hand Gabriel sends Bob flying across the diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. Michael grabs Jeep's hand before the boy can rush back into the fray. Michael let us go of Jeep's hand and turns away to face Gabriel leaving Jeep to contemplate those final words. And that is when Jeep opens his hand to find the keys to Michael's police cruiser. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie. Audrey and the baby.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tom drags his cat closer and squeezes it with all his strength, laughter filling his mouth. Alex struggled hard to lift, and there it is a parrot's laughs. Emily stood puzzled, standing wide-eyed and lifting up the dog. Emily responds, walks to the table, flips on the television, attempting to mute the noise of the approaching storm. Out of the silence, the enchanting tunes of Frank Sinatra humming "Jingle Bells" fill the garage. The calm before the commotion. David supports Alex swiftly wipe herself off. She glares at him, a fiery disdain in her grin. Those statements offer her minimal solace. Alex nods skeptically. Alex glances urgently at David. The parrot laughs louder. Alex, shaken by this mystery, stretches out to Emily. Emily shifts to pass over the cat to Alex. Vincent retreats from them, advancing toward the rear window. David clicks his camera, aims it at Vincent. Alex faces off with Vincent, fear in her grin. Alex gazes at her in shock, the reality of those statements shaking her to the very essence. A dazzling magical aura floods into the garage. She elevates a foot to shield the aura. And that's when David clicks. SNAP! Vincent stumbles back, ink dripping from the spot on his shoulder. David clicks again, propelling Vincent's frame back through the garden. Oliver observes the dog soar slowly through the breeze. Oliver lunges for the dog, clutching the stack of leaves mere centimeters from the soil, and then he gazes up to notice the bright outline of a woman approaching from out of the magical aura, a woman with wings. Oliver's eyes widen as the fierce eagle steps into the garage. The eagle's wings retract with mechanical precision, and now that we see her face clearly, we notice her striking resemblance to David. Teresa lifts a massive, intimidating, strangely cybernetic-looking shield in her robust feet. The scenery reverts to typical tempo as Teresa directs the shield arcing down at Oliver. Oliver rolls, thunk! The device just misses him, striking the soil in a spray of glitter, literally fracturing the ground. Teresa hoists the shield up again. With a flick of her foot, Teresa sends Tom gliding across the garage where he collapses down behind the table near the oven. David clasps Oliver's paw before the child can charge back into the chaos. David releases Oliver's paw and pivots away to confront Teresa, leaving Oliver to ponder those concluding statements. And that's when Oliver opens his paw to discover the tickets to David's spaceship. Oliver gazes up from the tickets to see Alex, Emily, and the cat.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bob embraces his son tearfully as Charlie gives birth, with Audrey holding the newborn. She turns on the radio to mask approaching danger, but Bing Crosby's "Silent Night" plays instead, symbolizing calm before chaos. Michael helps clean up Charlie, who is overwhelmed, and tensions rise as Sandra retreats to the door. Michael confronts Sandra and fires, killing her. Jeep heroically catches the baby amid the chaos. Suddenly, a winged angel, Gabriel, emerges, resembling Michael. With a mechanical mace, Gabriel attacks, sending Bob flying. Michael faces off against Gabriel, handing Jeep the keys to his police cruiser. Jeep realizes the weight of his responsibility as he looks at Charlie, Audrey, and the baby.
